Stalking

Fla. Stat. § 784.048. Stalking; definitions; penalties. (2012)

(1) As used in this section, the term:

(a) "Harass" means to engage in a course of conduct directed at a specific 
person which causes substantial emotional distress to that person and 
serves no legitimate purpose.

(b) "Course of conduct" means a pattern of conduct composed of a series of 
acts over a period of time, however short, which evidences a continuity of 
purpose. The term does not include constitutionally protected activity such 
as picketing or other organized protests.

(c) "Credible threat" means a verbal or nonverbal threat, or a combination 
of the two, including threats delivered by electronic communication or 
implied by a pattern of conduct, which places the person who is the target 
of the threat in reasonable fear for his or her safety or the safety of his 
or her family members or individuals closely associated with the person, 
and which is made with the apparent ability to carry out the threat to 
cause such harm. It is not necessary to prove that the person making the 
threat had the intent to actually carry out the threat. The present 
incarceration of the person making the threat is not a bar to prosecution 
under this section.

(d) "Cyberstalk" means to engage in a course of conduct to communicate, or 
to cause to be communicated, words, images, or language by or through the 
use of electronic mail or electronic communication, directed at a specific 
person, causing substantial emotional distress to that person and serving 
no legitimate purpose.

that's the literal meanings of stalking in the State of Florida. It doesn't

+Aero HOSTALE Please don't put words in my mouth. I did not say that every 
bad thing said about Black people is a conspiracy. What I did was to point 
out a disparity between arrest and conviction rates, as well as how 
profiling has a lot to do with those arrest and conviction rates. The 
notion of "White on White" or "Black on Black" crime is a farce--as I 
explained that MOST crimes are committed against people of their own race. 
Crime is crime and murder is murder. Labeling it as a racial issue, rather 
than a socio-economic and mental health issue is wrong. It's as much of a 
farce as it is when people say there are no black serial killers. That is 
false too. There are black AND white serial killers, although the most 
notorious ones happen to be white, giving serial killing a white face. In 
reality, it's about the same when it comes to serial killers. 

Let's look at the FACTS that I presented:

Baldwin Hills--

Profile: 71% Black, 17.3% Latino, 3.3% White, 4.7% Asian, and 3.4% other. 
$37,948 median household income, 24.1% of residents 25 and older have a 
four-year degree.

Crime Rate summary for the last 6 months: 177 VIOLENT CRIMES -- 739 
PROPERTY CRIMES--285.1 CRIMES PER 10,000 PEOPLE (Most of these crimes are 
Theft and burglary, BTW, not violent crimes)

Downtown LA -- 

Profile: 36.7% Latino, 22.3% Black, 16.1% White, 21.3% Asian, 3.5% other-- 
$15,003 median household income (2008 dollars), 17.9% of residents 25 and 
older have a four-year degree--An overwhelming majority have "less than 
high school" educations. 

Crime Rate summary for the last 6 months:  500 VIOLENT CRIMES -- 1,938 
PROPERTY CRIMES  -- 117.5 CRIMES PER 10,000 PEOPLE (Most of these crimes 
are property crimes, with the violent crime more than doubled of that of 
Baldwin Hills). 

*____________________________________*

Conclusion: The fact that Baldwin Hills is predominately black does NOT 
show and increase in Violent crimes. What seems to differ is the income 
disparity as well as the education levels of these people. Race is not as 
much of a factor. Baldwin Hills has 50% more black people than the Downtown 
area. 

Under your logic, Baldwin Hills would automatically have a higher crime 
rate than that of Downtown, seeing that over 70% of the population is 
black. The white population of Downtown Los Angeles is more than 5x's 
higher than in Baldwin Hills. 

So again, tell me how this plays into the logic that Blacks automatically 
commit more crimes? Can we blame the increase of crime in Downtown LA 
because there are approximately 4.8 times more White people there? Blacks 
only make up 22% of the population Downtown. 

I think I've made my point PERFECTLY clear.

become masters at manipulating the public by making stats look like the big 
pic when they are, in fact, just giving a few small pieces.

comments.text:
This will my last post, and I'm going to sound a little pretentious, but 
oh well.  My hopes are that, ideally, people like you would stop buying 
wholesale into ignorant beliefs and values and traditions, that some races 
are innately unintelligent or evil, which is known to be ridiculous by all 
but a few scientists who are known by the others to be extremists and 
illogical. You say, my points are pointless, but they've 
logically countered most, if not, all of your points, so maybe they are 
meaningless to you, but they are logically relevant by any definitions of 
logic or argument any logician has contrived.   Here I'll make a couple of 
other counterpoints. 

Your notion of IQ tests is wrong, because most educators know it is 
virtually impossible to create a test both well rounded AND devoid of 
cultural bias.  Even a math test full of equations, which is as close 
to free from cultural bias as you may get, is not testing all of the 
intelligence complex.  In other words, intelligence is a vast phenomenon, 
and even if you can get a test to test a few mental processes, it would 
leave out others, and to test all of them would be difficult to do without 
language, which opens the door to much cultural bias.  

As well, your conception of "inference" is wrong (look up "inference" and 
"implication"); I made very little inferences in my previous post. But 
that's beside the point.  What makes a person truly wise is when he knows 
he is wrong and to be open to the fact that he is plentiful wrong.  Again, 
I am not a scientist, but I know enough to know that most of my science 
colleagues would scoff at your notions.  Human beings are complex, and no 
stats in the world can explain the various and vast behavioral patterns 
throughout history.  And even if we can use them to help us understand our 
current Black communities in American society, we cannot use them to make 
sweeping generalizations about crime, evil, and intelligence like you and 
others have done here.
comments.author: J Gonz

comments.text:
+Jordan Burr If you knew about philosophy, you'd know I was defining "end" 
as final goal, or that's all that is to it.  I was being sarcastic, since 
you rely so heavily on stats without analyzing them correctly.  In other 
words, your tunnel vision is keeping you from seeing (a) bigger 
picture(s).  And epistemology isn't a philosophy, it is a philosophical 
category, it is the study of knowledge, its nature, how we arrive at it, 
etc. And why are you bringing up intelligence?  Are you now saying that 
less intelligent people commit more crimes? Not even Johannsen himself 
would buy into your patchwork, misguided understanding of 
genotype-phenotype.

Also, I never argued "that environment is the only influence on the 
formation of one's phenotype" or anti-social behavior, which is just 
a substratum of one's phenotype.  I stated that environment typically plays 
a more significant role in anti-social behavior than race, and that stems 
from a consensus of academic scholars across so many fields. Even your idea 
about intelligence, however, is so warped and outdated (Nazi outdated), 
that you fail to understand (1) that all humans share 99% (I think 99.9%) 
of DNA, and that (2) intelligence, according to cognitive scientists, 
largely figures environmental interaction with the sensory and electrical 
and chemical make up of the brain. I could quote you University study after 
study that would squash whatever outdated data you have.  You're pulling 
stuff from 1911, when the last 2 decades have cracked the DNA code and have 
seen cognitive and neuro scientists make tons of steps into understanding 
more about an organ that still poses as a mystery.  

Finally, in response to your words, "so I gave him stats": Really? That's 
your response.  So you give him stats that you appear not to understand 
fully.  If I don't understand something fully, I (1) try to be more humble, 
or (2) try to understand it the best I can, or (3) put a disclaimer, or (4) 
keep my mouth shut until I can better understand the context of what 
I'm talking about.  Look, my disclaimer is this: science isn't my 
specialty, but I know enough to know that intelligence doesn't vary from 
race to race, that all humans possess a potential for thinking beyond all 
other species (as far as we know), and that yes, environmental factors (not 
alone, though) significantly impact human intelligence and its capacity 
to develop.  The moment you realize that no race is innately bad or dumb, 
the wiser you will be, my friend.  But if you really want to learn more 
about your arguments, research Nazi science.
comments.author: J Gonz

comments.text:

nearby home.


At least three were critically injured: Kearria Freed, 20, who was shot in 
the head; Devanta Moore, 21, who was shot in the chest; and Henton 
Franklin, 22, who was shot in the side. Three others were listed in stable 
condition: Jacole Young, 22, who police said was shot in the back three 
times; Kelli Curry, 21, who was shot in the leg; and Tykeria Ethridge, 22, 
who was shot in the neck and shoulder.
A seventh victim - Anesia Powell, 20 - was shot in the left arm, chest, and 
knee, and was undergoing surgery Saturday.
